message.content:
cs.MA, cs.RO, cs.DS, cs.SY, cs.AI. 

This paper deals with the problem of two mobile agents meeting in the plane, which is a classic problem in multi-agent systems and robotics. The use of sensors and estimation mechanisms to enable the agents to locate each other is a common theme in the field of multi-agent systems, which suggests that cs.MA (Multiagent Systems) is the most likely sub-category. The use of compasses and synchronized clocks to make moves also suggests that cs.RO (Robotics) is a likely sub-category. The problem of meeting in the plane can also be viewed as a problem in computational geometry, which suggests that cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) is another likely sub-category. The use of sensors and estimation mechanisms to locate the other agent also involves some level of control and decision-making, which suggests that cs.SY (Systems and Control) is a possible sub-category. Finally, the use of estimation mechanisms and decision-making also involves some level of artificial intelligence, which suggests that cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) is another possible sub-category.
